Articles.Content:
I went back and tweaked the design. Was able to move both components with ease, and the addition of the front gear allows a bit more of adjustment to get the docking ports to match up. The two sets of lander legs at the back also

work to adjust the overall height of the forklift to make mating easier.

I've looked into using Fraps for video, as well as Microsofts Expressions. Not sure if there is enough demand to warrant paying $30 for the full version.

Anyway, here are some screen shots of the forklift, and the eventual results.

I've found the craft files if interested, just not sure how to link them here....if anyone is interested, feel free to walk me through the process.

The two sets of legs in back give me a bit of "play" in how high the back end comes off the ground.

I've transferred all the fuel to the forklift, which helps counter balance the weight of the component. It handles a pretty decent load without tipping over.

Two of the modules that I was able to mate purely by using the forklift to position and get the docking ports to match up

Flag pretty much says it all I think....
